page.title: 04Edgbarrow Woods,Crowthorne
page.content:
Edgbarrow Woods is composed of 31.5 hectares of heathland,woodland and bog. Most of the area lies within a {Site of Special Scientific Interest.} {WOODLAND}occupies the higher ground. It is fairly recent in origin either having been planted or having invaded areas which were once heathland.
{DRY HEATH}is found on the slopes. At some time it has been deep ploughed to improve drainage. Burnt tree stumps are the evidence of many heath fires, particularly during the drought of 1976.
{WET HEATH & BOG}occupies the lowest ground. Deep ploughing has failed to improve drainage. The soils are deep, peaty and waterlogged. They smell strongly of marsh gas when disturbed.
